name: St. Bernardine of Siena
summary: Bernardine of Siena was a Franciscan friar and one of the most famous preachers of the 15th century. He traveled throughout Italy preaching repentance and reform, drawing large crowds. He promoted devotion to the Holy Name of Jesus and is credited with popularizing the IHS monogram. He was a key figure in the Observant Franciscan reform movement.
